creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Wilson Grabill
description: shrimp in curled position with long feelers pointing downward; curving lines and grey and black curlicues along top edge and LR; inscription L
inscription: at L: {Hakuin Osho iwaku / Higenagaku koshimagarumade / ikitakuba / shoku o hikaete / shoku o hikaeyo} (Monk Hakuin says / if you want to live / till your beard grows so long / and your back begins to bend / be temperate in eating!)
markings:
URC, rectangular intaglio; LLC, square relief; LLC, square intaglio
(?) ga, Joko no in and Ken ka shotei
signed: 鶴亭道人禄写 {Kakutei dōjin rokusha}
title: Shrimp
